39449596.review:
Only recommending because it's free and the story is worth it. Also the soundtrack is pretty good.

But really I was hoping it would have at least a couple of choices, especially when there is an option in the game that depends on choices. It also means the skip feature is completely useless, because nothing new can be seen in a second playthrough; it just skips through the entire story.

- Edit: I was not aware that "kinetic visual novel" means that the player has no input on the story, so I shouldn't have hoped :) Still weird it has the option in the game though under preferences.

It is also very short, which might be a positive or a negative, depending on what you want.

38132705.review:
I came into this after reading the other reviews, wanting to see why it was rated with such positive feedback.

This is what I got, but it's kind of long.

The story is very well written, even by my obsessive grammatical standards- I didn't notice a single typo, and the word choices were well-picked. From a storyline standpoint, it does an amazing job connecting you to the characters, and you almost feel like you actually know them as people once your two hour-long playthrough is up.

That's another thing. The time. It feels longer than it is, due to the different thoughts emotions brought up. It lingers on subjects for just the right amount of time before leaving you to think about it then bringing up another. The existential ideas brought an experience I didn't expect and won't forget.

I'd say it's worth a read, even if you're not normally into VN's; I wasn't when I first downloaded this.

36316990.review:
Best piece of short-form sci-fi I've read in a good long while. Didn't suffer for its length, or for the medium through which it was told. It gives a strong and vehement answer to a question we shouldn't still be having to ask, but that we still see being fought over every day: [spoiler]who qualifies as human? and where do we draw the lines of prejudice, on whom we treat as equals or inferiors?[/spoiler]

This story'll stick with me for awhile, and give me a good deal to think about. And I can't ask for more from good fiction than that.

35756611.review:
SIN SPOILER >>> Completada la historia, todas las escenas desbloqueadas

Novela visual SIN PUNTOS DE ELECCIÓN que trata sobre un viajero espacial y su piloto de I.A. Solo dos personajes, en una pequeña nave, son los ingredientes necesarios para conseguir una poderosa trama emocional que no dejará a nadie indiferente. Sin embargo lo comentan muchos usuarios y es verdad, no es un título casual ni para todos los públicos, en el sentido que para disfrutarlo es totalmente imprescindible: Leer bien el inglés y tener gusto para larga lectura, la ciencia ficción y el tema de las IA's

Gráficos y Tecnología >>> POBRE + 0,5 puntos

Mucho novel pero poco visual; contraste entre fondos de naves espaciales hechos a 3D con gráficos 6G y un artwork anime para el personaje que veréis dibujada (la piloto artificial). Los primeros son correctos para una novela así y ambientan bastante, eso sí, como fondos estáticos. En cambio la chica tiene un dibujo correcto que quiere ser bonito pero que le falta algo para cargar con todo el peso que tiene en la historia. Ese arte gráfico tiene en todo momento sensación de quedarse escueto, sobretodo comparado con la inmensa cantidad de texto a leer, y no justifica el peso de 631 mb que ocupa el juego.

Historia y Niveles >>> BIEN ! + 1,5 puntos

Palinurus se esfuerza mucho en tener una buena historia, por que sabe que es el único punto con el que cuenta y el que justifica su creación. En muchos aspectos el juego es como leer un libro, las ilustraciones están ahí pero si no estuvieran nada cambiaría. Eso significa que sí, la historia contada es de buena calidad: Tiene un planteamiento eficaz y que genera interés, y un desenlace extraordinariamente poderoso que sorprende por su intensidad y los sentimientos que despierta. Pero el desarrollo central se pierde un poco por las nebulosas del frío espacio y puede ser algo tedioso, demasiado detallista. Hay mucho texto, mucho, se intenta disimular entregando pocas líneas en cada clic pero para contar la misma historia sobraba un poco de metraje.

No pierde calidad por ser tan largo pero sí puede dejarse algunos lectores por el camino; debes considerar que yo soy alguien que juega visual novels, que adora la ciencia ficción del tema en concreto que trata la historia y aun así estoy reconociendo que puede hacerse un poco pesada por la parte de en medio. La historia necesitaba elecciones para el jugador? Hm comprendiendo el final entiendo que no las pusieran. Eso sí, maravilloso el personaje de Budapest, han hecho un enorme trabajo de concepto con ella y su evolución durante toda la trama. Realmente es ella (la I.A) el núcleo vibrante de todo el juego y lo que más valía tiene. +0,5 de valor añadido por conseguir hacerme empatizar tan profundamente con ella.

Música y Sonidos >>> OK + 1 puntos

Muy desigual en ese aspecto, con buenos temas de ambientación en algunos puntos, música clásica en otros, y a veces temas que pueden ser molestos para seguir la historia aunque eso es más culpa de la edición que del propio tema musical. A veces un bucle de un tema muy corto dura muchas líneas de texto, haciéndolo pesado, cuando en realidad el tema no es malo de per se y es muy adecuado a lo que se narra.

Control y Jugabilidad >>> BIEN ! + 1,5 puntos

Solo necesitas el ratón, como es obvio. Palinurus tiene los típicos controles habituales de todas las visuals, avanzar y retroceder los textos, creación y carga de puntos de guardado que funcionan perfectamente, posibilidad de mostrar el texto más o menos deprisa según el gusto. Una pregunta hago: ¿por qué se puede elegir detener o continuar el modo rápido nte las elecciones... si no hay elecciones que tomar? Motor prediseñado? Aparte de eso no he encontrado ningún problema en el motor del juego ni en la generación de textos, es un juego bien construido.

Integración en Steam >>>  OK + 1 puntos

No tiene logros, ni cromos, ni marcadores, el producto queda un poco virgen como arrojado a Steam sin más. Muchas otras visual novels gratuitas tienen algunos logros, soy consciente que no hay toma de decisiones ni nada que premiar pero hubiese sido ideal un único logro de haber leído toda la historia, o un logro más de visualizar créditos o artworks. La razón de que esto es un problema es que Steam no contabiliza como “completados” juegos que no tienen logros aunque hayas superado todo el contenido. Sin embargo valoro mucho el hecho que sea totalmente gratuito, tiene razonable calidad si consideramos eso último.

CONCLUSIÓN FINAL >>>  5,5  Aprobado y Recomendado

Si fuera un cuento, un libro o un libro digital Palinurus tendría una nota bastante más alta. Queda corta por querer aportar un entorno gráfico y sonoro que no está a la altura cuando la historia realmente no pide más que negro sobre blanco y una imaginación bien nutrida. La historia es buena, merece MUCHO la pena conocer a Budapest, y el final es de enorme calidad pero llegar a él es largo y puede hacerse pesado a los casuals. Siendo gratuita, no hay razón para no tomar ese viaje y perderse, con una bonita compañía, entre las estrellas fugaces del vasto espacio inexplorado. Novela recomendada.

32010092.review:
Not half bad for a free game. In fact, I might even go so far as saying its story easily rivals that of many paid visual novels. 

As the description goes, you're a drifter traveling to Alpha Centauri in search of fortune. However, a meteor storm soon damages your shuttle and takes you off course. For the remainder of the game you'll be stuck with Budapest, the shuttle's beautiful artificial intelligence. [i]Palinurus[/i]'s strength is the ensuing bond that forms between the passenger and Budapest, as the former begins to see her as more than just random lines of code and together they explore concepts like death, feelings, and loneliness. The music is sparse but well chosen, with pieces like Tchaikovsky's 1812 Overture (I'm a sucker for classical music) or a most delightful arrangement of Beethoven's Ode to Joy.

As fas as the negatives go, sometimes there will be a lot of text to read without anything going on in the background. In fact, backgrounds are few and rather bland for the most part, but it's not like I paid top dollar for this. The game's unfortunately short, clocking about an hour, with a predictably sad ending, but the execution more than makes up for it. I wouldn't mind seeing a KS-backed enhanced version of the game sometime in the future.

If you can afford to get stranded in uncharted space for an hour, why not give [i]Palinurus[/i] a shot? Budapest might just conquer your heart.

32001268.review:
Another free visual novel!
I've read that this game were created within 2 weeks, so it is very impressive.

The story is quite short, you can see I finished the game in less than 2 hours. It is based on the Roman myth, very interesting take when the game is set in space travel.

The art and ost are normal, not very special, but good enough. More would be better, but remember they only had 2 weeks.
There are no gameplay at all, it's pure VN, or Kinetic Novel as they say.

I've had better VN, but this one is definitely a good one, especially for beginner on this genre.
7/10 would feel humanity again.

31243681.review:
buenas, iba a escribir el review en ingles  [strike]Pero al ver la pereza de los habla hispana[/strike] pero al ver la inexistencia de reviews en espanol decidi dar un paso adelante y hacerla en espanol.

[h1]Que es una novela visual[/h1]
Una novela visual es un relato escrito como un libro. Pero la gran diferencia entre un libro y esto es que la novela visual cuenta con dibujos estilo anime (principalmente inmoviles) y mayormente decisiones que hacen cambiar el final (aunque no es una regla, por ejemplo esta carece de decisiones)

[h1]De que se trata?[/h1]
Palinurus es una novela visual (muy buena) de sciensa fiction que transcurre en 2500s en el cual estas en una nave de 1 persona viajando hacia "Alpha Centauri" con una Inteligencia artifical peliroja (lo mejor) llamada Budapest. en el camino, tu nave espacial se va a la p*ta por ciertos accidentes y terminas varado en espacio inexplorado.

[h1]La Recomiendas?[/h1]
Emociones=Me gusta bastante leer Novelas visuales y esta me atrajo bastante. Los creadores hicieron un buen trabajo tratando de darte diferentes emociones, muchas veces vas a reir, entristecerte, te vas a desesperar, en ese apartador es lo mejor que trae esta VN
Gameplay=El Gameplay en la VN no es muy abierto. Mayormente es elejir decisiones mientras lees. Lo triste es que esta experiencia carece de decisiones dejando lo que ya en si no es tan abierto en algo tan cerrado que el final siempre sera el mismo. y para los que no hablan ingles, lamento decir que la novela visual es 100% ingles.
Graficos=Los dibujos son bastante bonitos, pero repetitivos. Se nota el exfuerso pero los dibujos no cambian, se van repitiendo y solo se cambian pocas cosas como si esta feliz, triste, llorando, sonrojada y cosas asi. Mayormente Budapest esta de frente, de perfil o tocando la pantalla tactil de la nave. Aunque como dijen son muy bonitos los dibujos y realmente me enamoro el sistema de dibujado
Banda Sonora=La banda sonora es simplemente hermosa, aunque los personajes no hablen ni siquiera te afecta devido a que en el fondo hay musica dependiendo del momento, mayormente hay musica de piano del siglo 18 y 19 que da un aire muy sactifactorio
Historia= Por ultimo la historia, en si nunca jugue una novela visual que tuviera una historia, siquiera parecida. Todo era mayormente maquinas que podian enviar mensajes al pasado, Asesinatos imprevisto por un parasito que probocaba descomfiar de todos, simuladores de citas con chicas que les hacen bulling, etc. Pero nunca jugue una que se tratara de quedarse varado en el espacio con una inteligencia artificial. Es bastante innovador pero... Para ser sincero es Demasiado corta.

Le doy 7/10 puntos. Es muy pero muy buena, pero es corta. Demasiado corta, en la historia pasan [spoiler] 30 dias [/spoiler] pero realmente estas con Budapest nada mas que [spoiler] 2 dias devido a que solo te fuiste a dormir 2 veces en toda la jodida VN [/spoiler] no tiene mucha logica, aparte me gustaria otro final, fue muy raro y todo paso muy rapido pero bueno. es una buena VN que te recomiendo jugar si entiendes un poco de ingles, en mi caso soy bilingue haci que no me afecto, Bye bye.

I enjoyed the game, the times the Passenger and the AI had their time together. Through their troubles and hardships they pulled through was an amazing experience but the ending was truely heart wrenching. For an ending like that, I believed they could still be together like a last second miracle but that never did occur. It was really sad. The last moments of them being together really made me cry. 

Overall, game is fantastic and you can really feel how the characters from their point of views on the situation. 
It's quite short but a nice experience and I wish it go could of gone a little longer, maybe to experience what happend to the passenger at the end or if it was possible to have a different outcome.

30646261.review: Palinurus is a science fiction visual novel about an interstellar passenger and the artificial intelligence navigator aboard his shuttle. It's an excellent, wonderful exploration of what it truly means to be human. It will make you smile, cry, and contemplate. I highly, highly recommend this story to everyone, even if you aren't traditionally a fan of these kind of "games".

30620731.review: This is a great story, and this would be more of a book review then a game review if I would write a real, long review for it. My overall opinion is that you should read it. You really should read it. Its a great story and its free, so there is no reason to read it. Whether you like visual novels or not. You should read it. It has a great story and I will not spoil any part of it. Just pick this novel up and read it, its free and its a great story. Just go pick it up blind.

30561598.review: I ,in all honsty, wasn't expection much when I was looking at this VN deciding whether or not to download it; but I decided to give it a shot and I am really glad I did. Sure, it's not purfect but my one complaint is that the sound is not always consistent /or changes abruptly but I was able to ignore those issuses because not only was the choice in music really good but i really liked the story, and to be honest it's on the list of few games (even though this is a VN imma call it a game) that made me get emotional because of the story, I'd even place on the same list for movies and shows; but only because that list is shorter. Best of all it's cost nothing but a couple hours and the energy to click a mouse to enjoy so give this thing a shot.

30289207.review: This is awsome!!!!! It really drew me in. I cant even say how much I wanted more:) Veary great storry I highly siggest reading it:)

30231500.review:
Palinurus is a visual novel that only costs you a chunk of an afternoon. If you like visual novels, it's great and definitely worth your time! And if it's not, what are you doing here? You're silly.

Its greatest strengths are in its writing and usage of spirtes- The banter feels natural for the most part, the two characters are fleshed out well in the time they have, and there's a surprisingly wide variety of sprites that add some life to the story. Those, along with some interesting themes, make it a solid and relaxing way to spend a few hours.

30209442.review:
This is effectively a short story that nevertheless manages to endear itself to the audience in a short span of time.  Clearly a labour of love, Palinurus is both introspective and philosophical.  Treat it as a literary work rather than a technical or flashy display of computer graphics and video gaming, and you would be rewarded with a good read and a special something that strikes an emotional chord deep within.

I would highly recommend interested readers to find the time (1 ~ 2 hrs) to immerse themselves in it from beginning to end.

30187471.review:
Palinurus is a kinetic visual novel (that is, there are no choices) about a Passenger on a ship with an AI voyage companion named Budapest.  The story prompt seems simple on paper, but what distinguishes this simple concept from other simple VN concepts is that the quality of writing and storytelling in this VN in particular is exceptional.  Perhaps to make this more impressive is knowing that the main part of the writing was done in a month for NaNoRenO.

As a brief aside to the music and art quality of the game, I would like to say that both are adequate.  I found the music overall to be rather mundane, but there are a few pieces that, in my opinion, fit excellently with the mood of the setting and enhanced the reading experience.  Likewise, the art quality would from time to time switch from mediocre to cute and pretty, but felt somewhat inconsistent, and sometimes unfitting to the mood.  Overall, I would say the music and art were supplements to otherwise exceptional writing.

When I say the writing is exceptional, I don't mean to say "exceptional for a VN writer in particular," but exceptional in the sense that someone (though, there were multiple writers) with a firm control of English rhetoric and emotional storytelling wrote it.  The short story is filled with humor and serious moments that flow naturally and realistically.  At points in their space-travelling, the Passenger and Budapest would frequently tease each other in the same way friends (or perhaps a romantic couple) might, and it feels quite heartwarming and funny to watch the frivolity.  These brief intermissions of happiness, in my opinion, do well in emphasizing the dramatic moments of the game, which feel very heartfelt.  You feel a sense of identity in the deuteragonists of the story and it's easy to form an emotional connection to both of them.  This is the mark of a story largely written by a skilled contemporary writer in the making.

As a brief digression on the emotional impact of the game; even the main develop of Renpy made a comment on his Twitter of the game's sentimentality: https://twitter.com/renpytom/status/583849407474458626

The game is not too long, perhaps an hour's length - shorter if you're a quick reader.  I've refrained from detailing any specific plot points at the risk of making them less dramatic or humorous.  It's a VN that's well worth your time, and I hope will at least make you ruminate about the themes in the game, which are fairly straightforward but otherwise thought-provoking.  It is certainly a beautifully-written game and, I should hope, can become a standard for proficiently written VN's in the future.

30183531.review: Not perfect, but it exceed, even for a free game.

30171268.review: Very nice and well-made, relentlessly tugs at your heartstrings and gets you invested in the characters and story, and there are some surprising things that happen near the end. Would absolutely recommend on the basis of both being free and taking only three hours to play.

30077843.review:
Quite entertaining story.
Great as they developed thier relationship throughout the journey.
Really sad ending though.
Maybe do a sequel where hes rescued and comes back to space to find her and brings her home with him to use as a house AI or similar ?

30049995.review:
This is a visual novel, so all  you're going to be doing is reading, so if you're not a fan of reading and/or literature, this may not be for you. 
Very simple, short, and (yet) captivating story whose theme is fairly similar to that of Philip K. Dick's [i]Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?[/i] in regards to artificial intelligence as well as what it means to be human. I really enjoyed and appreciated the great effort towards the characterization. What was also neat was that it was not only philosophical but educational as well, especially with the historical facts.
I would be very interested in reading another work from Watercress and would, of course, hope for a sequel to Palinurus.

30030519.review:
If you explicitly avoid subpar artstyles and wordy books you shouldnt install.
However, if you 1) are a sucker for sappy stories 2) would like to re-challenge your sanity 
3) want some basic exposure to VNs, or novels general, before delving deeper 4) have a 
strong enough (admit it) fetish for redheads in white dresses

What i'm saying is, this isnt for everyone, but if you want to, do give it a go. Have a good
45 minutes, battery where applicable, resilient index finger and quick reading speed, and
enjoy some freshly cut onions at your chin.

29843403.review: Какого-то игрового оргазма я не почувствовал

29818043.review: Very well done. Short (2hrs-ish, without breaks), minimalist, but it suits the story well. Well written, with only a few stumbles. Very cute art and manages to absorb you. Interesting concept and pretty good exploration of some ideas, even in the short period. Enjoyed it far more than I expected. Just excellent.

29813580.review:
Don't let the existentialism in, DON'T LET IT IN. A short visual novel about a lonely trip through space with an AI that might be something more. Some parts of the story are pretty cliche and I can't say that any part of the story brought out any genuine emotion in me at all. I didn't particularly care for the limited art style, either. I'm still going to go with a positive rating because the game is free and was designed under unusual circumstances, and I suspect others my find it more moving than I did. In space, no one can hear you cry. 
Unless you're an AI with an intact Sentience Inhibiting Chip, this will hit you right in the feels. Hard.
A bit short, but powerful none the less.  If you are well-versed in the genre of visual novels (VNs), you will find Palinurus to be a well-written, tight little story that was made as a NaNoRenO 2015 submission by Watercress Studios. If you are a casual VNer, or new to the genre entirely, say perhaps a fan of anime and anime styled art, then you will find Palinurus to be a surprisingly deep and introspective story with great music and very cool storyline. Keep in mind that the studio is all volunteer, and NaNoRenO is a game jam where developers are challenged to make a visual novel from start to finish - in just one month! Palinurus is noteably impressive for being such a rapidly developed story. The strength is in the synergy between the poignant message, the character interaction and the amazing music composition. This VN is great. It is absolutely worth the experience of reading through.

29734121.review: If you are well-versed in the genre of visual novels (VNs), you will find Palinurus to be a well-written, tight little story that was made as a NaNoRenO 2015 submission by Watercress Studios. If you are a casual VNer, or new to the genre entirely, say perhaps a fan of anime and anime styled art, then you will find Palinurus to be a surprisingly deep and introspective story with great music and very cool storyline. Keep in mind that the studio is all volunteer, and NaNoRenO is a game jam where developers are challenged to make a visual novel from start to finish - in just one month! Palinurus is noteably impressive for being such a rapidly developed story. The strength is in the synergy between the poignant message, the character interaction and the amazing music composition. This VN is great. It is absolutely worth the experience of reading through.

29706239.review:
[u][b]PŘÍBĚH[/b][/u]

Palinurus je krátká kinetická novela, která nás zavede do né tak blízké budoucnosti. Příběh se odehrává v době, kdy lidstvo je už schopno cestovat mezi planetami, objevovat vesmír a využívat umělou inteligenci. Hlavní postavou je člověk, který nasedá na loď mířící na odlišnou planetu za cílem se podívat na neznámou kulturu. Ale to není důležité. Po pár chvilí od vzletu se dostane do meteroidové bouře, která závažně poškodí loď. Najednou se ocitne v nekontrolovatelné lodi s pilotkou Budapest (A.I.), která ztratila omezující čip a stává se tak umělou inteligencí se srdcem člověka.

[u][b]POCITY[/b][/u]

Vesmír není moje nejoblíbenější prostředí. Obecně sci-fi nemám moc rád. Ale přiběh o cestovateli vesmírem a panikující umělé inteligenci uvězněných v nekontrolovatelné ocelové kouli, mě naprosto ohromil. Jejich bezmoc je dala dohromady a budující vztah mezi Budapest a Cestujícím napříč vesmírem mě nechal se zatajeným dechem až do konce. Konec je trochu ustřižený, ale prostě cliffhanger musí být.

[u][b]ZÁVĚR[/b][/u]

[b]Tohle je jedna z těch zadarmo kratších novel, která se spíše zaměřuje na příběh a jeho emotivní dopad. CG není špatné, ba dobré, ale mohlo být použito nějakých těch holografických efektů, aby dodali dojem. Hudba je takový průměr, začne být velice repetetivní a máte chuť si ji stlumit. Ale o to mi nejde. Jde mi hlavně o příběh, který je naprosto skvělý. Zápletka je podle mě originální a scény, kdy společně probírají historii ze Země, se mi velice líbily.[/b]

29558112.review:
In space, no one can hear you cry. 
Unless you're an AI with an intact Sentience Inhibiting Chip, this will hit you right in the feels. Hard.
A bit short, but powerful none the less. 
10/10

29534154.review:
Палинур - короткая, кинетическая (без выборов в диалогах) визуальная новелла в жанре научной-фантастики, с грустным, философским и чертовски хорошим сюжетом.

[i]Справка: Палинур - персонаж Энеиды и античных мифов. Опытный навигатор, работал кормчим у Энея, героя Троянской войны. Когда узнал что боги пропустят корабль троянцев из Сицилии в Италию только получив жертвоприношение, решил пожертвовать собой и прыгнул в море. Был выброшен на берег, где был убит местными жителями. Боги получили свою жертву, троянцы добрались до Италии.[/i]

1) [u]Сюжет[/u]: новелла поведает нам историю путешественика, отправившегося в путь с космической станции, на шаттле под управлением искусственного интеллекта, по направлению к нужной ему колонии на Альфа Центавре. Но корабль попал в астероидный шторм в результате чего был сильно поврежден. В результате наш герой оказался заперт в дрейфующем корабле, один на один с бескрайним космосом и искусственным интелектом с уничтоженным модулем блокирующим эмоции. 

В сюжете поднимаются много философских вопросов - о войне, искусстве, жизни и смерти, смысле бытия и многом другом. Главная тема которая пронизывает сюжет - когда искусственный разум остается машиной и когда он уже переходит грань осознания себя настолько, что его можно уже считать живым существом? Кто помнит книги вроде -  "Снятся ли андроидам электроовцы?" Филиппа Дика, тот проникнется сюжетом еще больше. Есть много отсылок к классическим произведениям искусства, будь то музыка, фильмы или мифы. История в игре пронизана светлой грустью, концовка же запомнится надолго. Сюжетно это имхо одна из лучших НФ новелл что мне встречались.

2) [u]Графика и звуки[/u]: новелла сия больше про сюжет, поэтому артов мало. Задники в основном представлены темным и звездным космосом, за исключением начальной станции. Большая часть артов это наш прекрасный ИИ. Музыка мягкая, мелодичная и приятная, часть трэков - обработка классики.

3) [u]Язык[/u]: новелла сия только на английском. Язык здесь имхо не слишком сложный, но при этом есть довольно много культурных сносок, плюс поэтические обороты речи, поэтому стоит это иметь ввиду, если есть сомнения касательно своего уровня владения языком.

[u]Как итог[/u]: одна из лучших в сюжетном плане научно-фантастических новелл, с хорошей историей и философским наполнением. Любителям жанра, рекомендую категорически!
10 бескрайних глубин космоса из 10.

29054729.review:
Length: Very Short (<2 hrs)
Avg Read time: 70 to 100 mins
Type: Kinetic Novel

Description: A drifting traveler boards a one-man space shuttle destined for Alpha Centauri. This shuttle is piloted by Budapest, an artificial intelligence program designed to serve humanity. She is a hardworking, diligent program, just a little naïve to the ways of the universe, and intensely dedicated to her directive. But when disaster unexpectedly befalls their ship, the two of them are sent careening through uncharted space, left with dire prospects for rescue. 

Overall: Nice little story based on the Roman myth of Palinurus. Worth the time to read through and surprised at the writing quality since this was made in 2 weeks for NaNoRenO 2015. 

6/10

28618763.review:
The moment the intro music played, i thought it was going to be one of those asmr soundtracks lol.

But i totally did not expect to hear THAT music and you can tell what kind of VN this is going to be just by listening to it.

Did i regret playing this? Well yes. The heaps of emotions that i got after finishing this novel is not something one could just brush off easily.

28501011.review: A great and beautiful VN which had me in tears at the end. ;-;

28483962.review:
This sad little game that I did not expect to get so emotional with is quite remarkable. The game at its core is generic and dull yet when you go past the introduction the dialogue between the main characters compels and intrigues you. 

Through their relationship, they both discover a type of caring love for each other and trust. The void of space that distances them for cavillation is a key turning point that brings them closer because it causes the fear and helpless needed to think and question themselves and each other. 

Some hard-hitting questions such as what is life and what is the value we placed on it, as well as love, exploration and discovery. 

A worthwhile read that still has the potential to be so much more if more time was spent.  
I look forward to future games by this developer as entertaining or better then this one.

28473313.review: Beautiful, it's not a story relying on conflict or plot but really just the interaction between two beings, and the thoughts of handling the result of a problem and coping with the consequences. Read it if you appreciate a touching story.

28434326.review:
Taking place some time in the 2500s, you play as a space traveler who boards a single-person space shuttle bound for Alpha Centauri. Along with the traveler is the ship's artificially intelligent navigator known as Budapest who, in order to better interact with passengers, takes the form of a hologram of a young woman. The trip to Alpha Centauri starts off rather routine, but an encounter with meteoroids damages the ship and sends them off course. It is then that the traveler and Budapest must figure out what to do until a possible rescue in deep space.

This game is a kinetic novel, a type of visual novel with no branching story lines, only one ending, and no decisions required by the player. It can be played as quickly as the player can read it.

As it is the main purpose of a kinetic novel, I would say that the story is pretty good. As this is a rather short visual novel, I cannot say too much without going into spoilers, but suffice it to say that I found the story well written with an interesting theme about what it means to be human and to live. Not exactly the most original premise in science fiction works, but the game does a good job of its take on it.

The art itself is passable and pleasing enough to look at, even if it is more standard fare. I thought that the music could have been better as some of the tracks were rather grating to listen to on a loop during certain parts of the game.

Overall, I enjoyed this visual novel. For me, it took a little over an hour and a half to read. If you like visual novels and are looking for an enjoyable story, I would give this a recommend. After all, it is free so it is worth a read.

28415455.review:
Des arts works très beau, un scénario plutot triste et une IA trop mignonne, c'est ce que vous reserve ce jeu, qui vaut largement 10/10 !
Si vous êtes hésitant, foncé, vous ne regretterez pas d'avoir passer du temps sur ce jeu la ;)

28381616.review:
[h1]In space, no one can hear you... (insert appropriate word choice here)[/h1]

[b]The Nitty:[/b]
[list]
[*] Kinetic novel
[*] Sci-fi
[*] c. 2 hours in length (give-or-take)
[/list]
...and [b]The Gritty:[/b]

Palinurus is an agreeable two-hour tour through the cosmos with entertaining dialogue between the protagonist and his vessel's accompanying AI program. During the dialogue something happens. When does a computer program stop being just lines of code, and just what is it that makes a sentient being a sentient being? Reality can blur with cold infinity at your fingertips. In addition to the affable plot I also enjoyed the music selection which varied between classical and what I would describe as 70's-era "Dr. Who"-like synth-pop. All the music selections seemed to fit the moment. The art, while not widely varied, is very well done.

9.5/10. Will likely tour the cosmos again.

28332885.review: Kurze emotionale Geschichte über einen Weltraumreisenden mit seiner KI. Es ist Kostenlos und wenn man auch nur Ansatzweise emotionale kleine Sci-fi Geschichten mag, kann man hier nichts falsch machen

28331845.review: More of a 'visual story' then a game, as there's no real choices to be made. Still a great story, made me cry multiple times, especially the ending. Really want to see more adventures of the character your viewpoint is played from, though.

28314869.review: It's short, non-interactive, and with only a few visuals to add to the story, yet it was surprisingly good, there were some truly heartfelt moments in their and it's definitely worth checking out especially for free.

28302490.review:
The story kept me interested until the tearful ending and I like the soundtrack. The images are nice 
although I would have liked to see more of them in a VN. 
The game didn't work for me with Steam overlay out of the box. After changing compatibility to 
'run as administrator' I was able to start it with the overlay although it didn't show playtime and 
I couldn't take screenshots.
It took me about two hours to finish the game.
 
The developers offer this game for free while they could easily ask money for it. 
I played Palinurus on Win10_64 Pro with an i7 4790 K and R9 390X @4k 60Hz. 
Palinurus is clearly a labor of love and I rate it of 7/10.

28293965.review: The music in this game is great, honestly you can't go wrong downloading this just to listen to the fantastic music! Great job watercress!

28288342.review:
What is it with computer nerds and techno music?

   Don't get me wrong: electronic music is a passion of mine, and can be used to considerable atmospheric effect. This effect, unfortunately, goes well out the window the second one puts a jarringly obnoxious thumpy-thump beat to it. Add to this some understandably limited production values and the single LOUDEST music mix I have ever heard in a product released to Steam, and neither my ears nor headphones were off to a good start with this "game".

   Fortunately my computer does have a volume switch, and the music tracks after the initial one were actually quite charming and refreshingly beat-free. But they do say that first impressions linger, so it's a good thing I'm such a mutha-fuckin' professional and can get past such things, at least enough to be "mostly objective. Mostly" (that's a recent and direct quote from a lecturer/marker of mine in the arts degree I'm currently studying; so if SHE gets to be labelled a "professional", so do I, fuck you all).

   Immersion-breaking beginnings aside, the rest of this product is actually quite aesthetically-pleasing. The artwork is endearing if unexceptional, and the writing is unusually good for a visual novel. 

   Yes, you did hear me right: unusually good FOR A VISUAL NOVEL. You wouldn't expect it, but honestly, most of these things read like they were written by an especially precocious fourteen year-old (at best), or someone for whom neither English nor written communication skills are a forte (at worst). Unless your visuals are going to switch with every single click of a button, you'd best make sure your VN writer's way with words is at least comparable to that of a lower-level fiction writer. This VN certainly has no problems in that area, and even boasts moments of genuine wit and charm ("it was essentially a primitive form of an escape pod, except roomier and less reliable"). Very nice work, indeed.

   So what about the "story" itself? Hmmm. Well, first up, you need to know that this ISN'T an "interactive novel". It's a "kinetic novel", in which you don't make any choices; you just click through a story which unveils in a completely linear and non-negotiable fashion. A slightly spiffier way of presenting a short story or novella, in other words. Obviously this will be fine for some, and a deal-breaker for others. 

   As long as you're not in the latter category, the story of this VN is, I'm pleased to say...actually pretty darned good (if a tad on the sappy side)! I suspect it's not too much of a spoiler to say it has something to do with the "nature" of Artificial Intelligence, and the curious effects of the cold, vast loneliness of space...so if that sounds like your cup of tea (or, er, tube of space-paste), there really isn't much to hold you back. Especially when the frigger is FREE.

   All told, not a bad little effort at all (I even found myself getting the teeniest bit teary by the end)! Just be sure to have the volume turned way DOWN at the start, lest your precious eardrums should be decimated by the initial ill-advised bursts of ruthless techno-thumping.

Verdict: 7.5/10.

28287110.review: Palinurus is a pretty decent visual novel that I would recommend free VN fans check out. Palinurus is a sci-fi visual novel that takes place on a spacecraft where you are trapped in uncharted space alone with no one but an onboard AI for company.

Idk about a second playthrough, but the story is worth a look.

39471592.review: [spoiler]I DON'T KNOW IF HE DIED OR SURVIVED AND IT'S KILLING ME AND NOW I'M SITTING HERE AND I DON'T KNOW IF I SHOULD CRY OR FEEL GOOD OR FEEL BAD AND AAAAAAAAAAAA[/spoiler]

39497665.review: I mean, it's free and it was made in two weeks. This game is impressive. It definitely will evoke some feeling out of you, BUT it isn't the pinnacle of heart-wrenching moments in my very personal opinion. It takes on a very interesting topic and is well written given the sci-fi setting where you expect to be bombarded with fictional lore. Play and enjoy this game for what it is: an under two hour long assault on your feels. In the end you'll feel it was worth it!

40889499.review: If you want a relaxing hour or so play this by yourself in the dark. I highly recommend this visual novel! It's free and entertaining 9.8/10

40852908.review:
You can tell this is made in eastern Europe, it's as sad and intellectual as an Andrei Tarkovski movie. It's probably based on Stanislaw Lem's Solaris.

I'm going to start off with the bad part. From a technical standpoint it is pretty shoddy. The graphics are mediocre and the music should have been made to loop better. I understand it was made in a rush, but the anniversary edition could have pretty easily fixed some of theese problems.Also, having the gallery unlocked from the start is strange for VN fans, even if you end up seeing all of them eventually, since it's a kinetic novel.

Then we get to the story. It's good, really good. It's the first (and up untill now the only) VN to make me tear up. It would have been much better if released as a novel, you could have told me it was written by Arthur C. Clarke or the Strugatski brothers and I would have been none the wiser. 
As a writer for a VN myself, this sets the bar very high. Hell, I hope my artists can compensate for my story the way this game's writing does.

It's well worth the install. It's short and impactfull. I hope the devs keep releasing content, since it's unlike anything I've seen on the VN market before.

40657049.review: It is a wonderful story about saving someone's life and dealing with mortality. Also what it means to be human. Do you dream of electric sheep? sorry, I couldn't resist. :D :P

40523691.review:
That ending though...
This VN is probably one of my favorites and over the many others that i've read; most being emotional and sentimental, this is the only one that has actually made me cry. Absoutely recommend, awesome music, art, and UI.

40209770.review:
A wonderful story. I found myself drawn in, as were the characters, wishing for an end that did not come to pass...Yet.
If we ever figure out how to upgrade a phone that way, sign me up!
I highly recommend this novel.

40093736.review: Just perfect in every way shape and form. If you're contemplating to play this game just play it. The plot is deep and character development is beautifully executed.
